judgement_local.title: Formulation of Issues for determination
judgement_local.intro: Whether Court can suo motu formulate/re-formulate issue(s) arising from ground(s) of appeal for determination of an appeal
judgement_local.text: "In Chabasaya vs. Anwasi (2010) 10 NWLR (1201) 163 it was held by the Supreme Court that: - "... The law permits an appellate Court to ignore some or all issues in the briefs of argument and formulate its own issues, the way it deems them to be material once they are distilled from the grounds of appeal." In the earlier case of Sha vs. Kwan (2000) 8 NWLR (670) 685 @ 700, the apex Court had stated that:- "The Court of Appeal is at liberty and possess the jurisdiction to modify or reject all or any of the issues formulated by the parties and frame its own issues or, to reframe the issues by the parties if, in its views, such issues will not lead to proper determination of the appeal." "The Court of Appeal is at liberty and possess such issues will not lead to proper determination of the appeal."See also Onochie vs. Odogwu (2006) 6 NWLR (975) 65, Governor Ekiti State vs. Olubunmo (2017) 3 NWLR (1551) 1 @ 23."

judgement_local.title: Drawing the battle line
judgement_local.intro: How Reliable is Visual Studio Code
judgement_local.text: Visual Studio includes a code editor supporting IntelliSense (the code completion component) as well as code refactoring. The integrated debugger works both as a source-level debugger and a machine-level debugger. Other built-in tools include a code profiler, designer for building GUI applications, web designer, class designer, and database schema designer. It accepts plug-ins that expand the functionality at almost every level—including adding support for source control systems (like Subversion and Git) and adding new toolsets like editors and visual designers for domain-specific languages or toolsets for other aspects of the software development lifecycle (like the Azure DevOps client: Team Explorer)

judgement_local.title: A Feminist Plan for Sustainability and Social Justice
judgement_local.intro: addressing these challenges while recovering the ground thats been lost on gender equality and womens rights.
judgement_local.text: As the world reckons with the fallout of COVID-19, growing inequality and accelerating climate disasters, the need for a shared plan to recover and transform economies and societies has never been clearer. UN Womens new flagship report “Beyond COVID-19: A Feminist Plan for Sustainability and Social Justice” provides a roadmap for addressing these challenges while recovering the ground thats been lost on gender equality and womens rights.
